row.entry: Specify whether you want to turn the function on or off
Bring the AUT into focus by clicking into it at a certain position. AUT_DEFAULT uses the method which is set in the AUT configuration
Specify the column either by entering its index or its title. The first column is 1 (and so on). Index 0 refers to the header itself.
The operator you want to use for the selection of the column when entering the column as a string
Use this parameter to specify which command to execute.
Select the comparison method you want to use to check two values or variables.
Determine how an image is saved if the given path does not exist.
Use this parameter to insert a delay.
Set the amount of time (in milliseconds) to wait once a window has closed before continuing.
Set the amount of time (in milliseconds) to wait once a component or window has appeared before continuing.
Set the amount of time (in milliseconds) to wait before dropping the item you have dragged.
Define the path and filename of the saved image.
Define the direction you want to move in.
Set the parameter to true if you expect the component to be editable. Otherwise select false.
Set the parameter to true if you expect the component to be enabled. Otherwise select false.
Set to true if you expect the item/component to exist. Otherwise set to false
Describe the expected behavior of an action. This description will be displayed during execution.
yes will add the chosen item to the current selection, nowill begin a new selection.
Control how an image is saved if the destination file already exists.
Set to true if you expect the component to be in focus. Otherwise set to false.
The identifier (title, name, variable) of the window you want to switch to in your test.

entry.para: The type of identifier you want to use.

itemizedlist.listitem: title: The window title that you can see at the top of the window. This action only supports equals as a matching operator.
name: The internal javascript name for the window.

any: Use this option to be able to enter a javascript variable for the window. You must enter the variable name and value as described at:
http://selenium.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/docs/api/java/com/thoughtworks/selenium/Selenium.html#selectWindow%28java.lang.String%29

row.entry: true inserts the text after the the pattern, false inserts the text before the pattern
The index of the item you want to check. If you want to check the first item enter 1, if you want to check the fifth item enter 5
The path to an item as an indexpath. Use slash '/' as an separator to separate e.g. parent nodes from child nodes.

entry.para: Specify which key you want to (de-)activate

row.entry: Define whether a command should be run locally on the same machine as the ITE (true) or remotely on the machine where the AUT Agent is installed and the AUT is running (false).
The amount of pixels you wish to include in the screenshot at the bottom of the dialog. You can enter positive and negative values. Enter 0 to neither extend nor reduce the margin.
The amount of pixels you wish to include in the screenshot to the left of the dialog. You can enter positive and negative values. Enter 0 to neither extend nor reduce the margin.
The amount of pixels you wish to include in the screenshot to the right of the dialog. You can enter positive and negative values. Enter 0 to neither extend nor reduce the margin.
The amount of pixels you wish to include in the screenshot above the top of the dialog. You can enter positive and negative values. Enter 0 to neither extend nor reduce the margin.
Specify a key or keys to be pressed at the same time as the action is being executed. mod is the platform-independent first modifier (control on Win and Lin, cmd on Mac).

entry.para: Select which mouse button you want to click with.

row.entry: The amount of time in Milliseconds.
